events.event: Introduction of IBM mainframe computers
Charles Goldfarb at IBM helps invent Generalised Markup Language (GML) the first forerunner of HTML
events.markdown: [Charles Goldfarb](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_Goldfarb) at [IBM](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ibm) helps invent [“Generalised Markup Language” (GML)](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IBM_Generalized_Markup_Language) the first forerunner of HTML

events.event: Charles Goldfarb developed “Standard Generalised Markup” (SGML) language. The direct forerunner of HTML.
events.markdown: [Charles Goldfarb](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_Goldfarb) developed [“Standard Generalised Markup” (SGML)](http://www.drdobbs.com/blog/archives/2009/08/beyond_html_an.html) language. The direct forerunner of HTML.
Information Builders introduce [FOCUS](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FOCUS) for IBM mainframes. I would later (mid-80's) learn and support FOCUS.

events.event: I Left school and did summer jobs for the next 3 years while at uni in a mainframe operations department using IBM mainframes.
IBM “Document Composition Facility” product introduced using GML
events.markdown: IBM “Document Composition Facility” product introduced using [GML](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IBM_Generalized_Markup_Language)

[Commodore PET](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Commodore_PET) released. [Sinclair ZX80](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ZX80) released. First graphical microcomputer [spreadsheet](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spreadsheet), [VisiCalc](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/VisiCalc), launched.

events.event: I Left Uni having been exposed to the joys of Fortran programming via punched cards, a 72 step programmable Commodore calculator, analogue computing (!) and a PDP-11.
events.markdown: I Left Uni having been exposed to the joys of [Fortran](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fortran) programming via [punched cards](en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Punched_card), a [72 step programmable Commodore calculator](http://rskey.org/pr100), [analogue computing](en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Analog_computer) (!) and a [PDP-11](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PDP-11).

events.event: I Started fulltime work in IBM Mainframe operations, also learned to programme in the IBM APL mathematical language.
events.markdown: I Started fulltime work in IBM Mainframe operations, also learned to programme in the IBM [APL mathematical language.](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BBC_Micro)

events.event: IBM PC launched. BBC Micro launched. Sinclair ZX81 launched. Commodore Vic-20 launched.
events.markdown: [IBM PC](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IBM_PC) launched. [BBC Micro](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BBC_Micro) launched. [Sinclair ZX81](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sinclair_ZX81) launched. [Commodore Vic-20](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Commodore_VIC-20) launched.

events.event: In December 1981 I Purchased a BBC 'Model A' microcomputer and waited several months for it to arrive!
events.markdown: In December 1981 I Purchased a BBC “Model A” microcomputer and waited several months for it to arrive!

events.event: Early 1980s sees launch of Acumen, an OLAP/BI language and database developed in the UK by Mars – based on Strategem. I would later (mid-80's) learn and support Acumen, developing a number of key business systems in it and writing a variety of utility functions including charting and date/time utilities.
events.markdown: Early 1980s sees launch of [Acumen](http://freespace.virgin.net/john.elkin/acumen.htm), an OLAP/BI language and database developed in the UK by [Mars](http://www.mars.com) – based on Strategem. _I would later (mid-80's) learn and support Acumen, developing a number of key business systems in it and writing a variety of utility functions including charting and date/time utilities.

events.event: Upgraded my BBC Model A to a Model B. My first go at soldering electronics. Blew the ADC chip and had to buy a replacement.
Taught myself to programme in a variety of languages including BASIC, FORTH, PASCAL, LISP and 6502 Assembler. FORTH became my favourite and I joined the UK FIG (FORTH Interest Group).
events.markdown: Taught myself to programme in a variety of languages including [BASIC](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BASIC), [FORTH](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Forth_(programming_language)), [PASCAL](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pascal_(programming_language)), [LISP](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lisp_(programming_language)) and [6502 Assembler](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MOS_Technology_6502). FORTH became my favourite and I joined the [UK FIG (FORTH Interest Group)](http://www.forth.org/).

events.event: TCP/IP is adopted as the protocol standard for ARPANET, the forerunner to the Internet. Acorn Electron launched, FidoNet starts up.
events.markdown: [TCP/IP](https://www.britannica.com/technology/TCP-IP) is adopted as the protocol standard for [ARPANET](https://www.britannica.com/topic/ARPANET), the forerunner to the Internet. [Acorn Electron](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Acorn_Electron) launched, [FidoNet](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FidoNet) starts up.

events.event: Became an Analyst/Programmer learning COBOL and structured analysis and design. DNS services start, JANET UK universities network starts, Moderated newsgroups introduced on USENET, Apple Mac introduced.
events.markdown: Became an Analyst/Programmer learning [COBOL](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/COBOL) and [structured analysis and design](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Structured_analysis_and_design_technique). [DNS](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Domain_Name_System) services start, [JANET UK universities network](https://www.ja.net/) starts, Moderated newsgroups introduced on [USENET](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Usenet), Apple Mac introduced.

events.event: Replaced the BBC Micro with an Amstrad 6128 running CP/M, big mistake, a very boring machine.
events.markdown: Replaced the BBC Micro with an [Amstrad 6128](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amstrad_CPC) running CP/M, big mistake, a very boring machine.

events.event: NNTP created.
events.markdown: [NNTP](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Network_News_Transfer_Protocol) created.

events.event: Commodore Amiga A500 launched.
events.markdown: Commodore [Amiga A500](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amiga_500) launched.

events.event: Moved from COBOL programming to “Personal Computing”, mainframe style using ISPF, APL, Information Builders FOCUS (a 4GL reporting tool), a mainframe spreadsheet called DynaSoft Dynaplan (AFAIK the first spreadsheet to use 3 dimensions) and and 4th generation tool called Acumen (which would now be called an OLAP tool).
events.markdown: Moved from COBOL programming to “Personal Computing”, mainframe style using [ISPF](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISPF), [APL](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/APL_language), [Information Builders FOCUS](http://www.informationbuilders.com/products/focus) (a 4GL reporting tool), a mainframe spreadsheet called [DynaSoft Dynaplan](http://www.wrkgrp.com/dynasoft/index.html) (AFAIK the first spreadsheet to use 3 dimensions) and and 4th generation tool called [Acumen](http://freespace.virgin.net/john.elkin/acumen.htm) (which would now be called an OLAP tool).

events.event: Also taught myself PL/1 to do some utility programs. Worked with colleagues to build functions that would allow a pseudo-GUI to be created on a colour text IBM terminal screen. Following the recently released IBM 'Common User Interface' GUI standards. Also built a library to use IBM's mainframe charting libraries without having to purchase the eyewateringly expensive charting package. Both libraries used to good effect creating business applications using Acumen.
events.markdown: Also taught myself [PL/1](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PL/1) to do some utility programs. Worked with colleagues to build functions that would allow a pseudo-GUI to be created on a colour text IBM terminal screen. Following the recently released IBM “[Common User Interface](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IBM_Common_User_Access)” GUI standards. Also built a library to use IBM's mainframe charting libraries without having to purchase the eyewateringly expensive charting package. Both libraries used to good effect creating business applications using Acumen.

events.event: Document processing was done using a mainframe SGML based tool – a good early grounding for later HTML. Later on started to work with PC’s as well, OS/2 and IBM LAN Manager. Word processing using IBM Displaywrite then Lotus Ami Pro.
events.markdown: Document processing was done using a mainframe [SGML](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sgml) based tool – a good early grounding for later HTML. Later on started to work with PC’s as well, [OS/2](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/OS/2) and IBM LAN Manager. Word processing using [IBM Displaywrite](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DisplayWrite) then [Lotus Ami Pro](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ami_Pro).

events.event: Acorn Archimedes launched.
events.markdown: [Acorn Archimedes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Acorn_Archimedes) launched.

events.event: Replaced my Amstrad with a Commodore Amiga 500, a fantastic and imaginative personal computer. Learned about computer video, 3D imagery and rendering. The Amiga used Rexx for a system-wide scripting and automation language. I'd first learned Rexx on IBM mainframes.
events.markdown: Replaced my Amstrad with a Commodore Amiga 500, a fantastic and imaginative personal computer. Learned about computer video, 3D imagery and rendering. The Amiga used [Rexx](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rexx) for a system-wide scripting and automation language. I'd first learned Rexx on IBM mainframes.

events.event: FidoNet is connected to the Internet. IBM Mainframe spreadsheet: Dynaplan from DynaSoft already in use.
events.markdown: [FidoNet](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FidoNet) is connected to the Internet. IBM Mainframe spreadsheet: [Dynaplan](http://www.highbeam.com/doc/1G1-6603432.html) from DynaSoft already in use.
ARPANET ceases to exist, [Archie](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Archie_(search_engine)) released, first commercial [dial-up Internet](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dial-up_Internet_access) provider.

events.event: Lotus introduce IBM mainframe version of 1-2-3 spreadsheet (DynaSoft release Dynaplan v4.0 same year).
events.markdown: [Lotus introduce IBM mainframe version of 1-2-3 spreadsheet](http://findarticles.com/p/articles/mi_m0SMG/is_n3_v10/ai_8220232/?tag=content;col1) (DynaSoft release Dynaplan v4.0 same year).

events.event: Moved from Mainframes to PC’s full time, Introduced to Lotus Notes (release 2) and loved it. Got my first palmtop, a Psion 3. Got myself an Amiga 3000 under Commodore’s developer program. Great for 3D modelling (Imagine, Real-3D and Lightwave) and experiments with video. WAIS, Gopher and WWW started, PGP created.
events.markdown:
Moved from Mainframes to PC’s full time, Introduced to [Lotus Notes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HCL_Notes) (release 2) and loved it. Got my first palmtop, a Psion 3. Got myself an Amiga 3000 under Commodore’s developer program. Great for 3D modelling (Imagine, Real-3D and Lightwave) and experiments with video.
WAIS, Gopher and WWW started, PGP created.

events.event: Demon Internet Services started up in June, 1st low cost (£10 per month) service in the UK.
events.markdown: [Demon Internet Services](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Demon_Internet) started up in June, 1st low cost (£10 per month) service in the UK.
Got my second palmtop, a [Psion 3a](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Psion_Series_3). The Amiga’s got stolen along with all my disks and backups!! Replaced them with an Amiga 4000.
“Official” start of [SPAM](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spamming) (US law firm Canter & Siegel spam Internet newsgroups)
Moved from using [FIDOnet](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FidoNet) to the Internet thanks to Demon Internet Services.
Finally got my first PC at home after holding out for so many years! Demon Internet offers [ISDN](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISDN) access for £10 per month.
Got my 3rd palmtop, a [PalmPilot Professional](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PalmPilot_Professional).

events.event: Acorn leaves the personal computing market.
Got PC number 2, an AMD 1200MHz based one with 512MB of RAM.

events.markdown: Got my 4th palmtop, a [Sony Clie PEG-T625](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sony_CLI%C3%89_TJ_Series) (Palm OS 4.1). The last ever Palm OS device I would own.

events.event: Finally got broadband! Say bye-bye to Demon Internet & modems, hello to PlusNet.
events.markdown: Finally got broadband! Say bye-bye to Demon Internet & modems, hello to [PlusNet](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Plusnet).

events.event: Got an iPad 1 32GB.

events.markdown: Got a [Humax HDR Fox T2](https://uk.humaxdigital.com/product/hdr-fox-t2/ personal video recorder. Freeview HD, 2 channels.

events.event: Got iPhone 4 32GB – A massive step up from Windows Mobile.
Apple iPad 2 introduced.
Moved broadband onto an FTTC connection from Origin Broadband. 40Mbps down, 10Mbps up (could have more!). Bye-bye to “slow” old 2Mbps ADSL 2+, hello to downloading films in 5 minutes!
events.markdown: Moved broadband onto an [FTTC](en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fiber_to_the_x) connection from [Origin Broadband](http://www.origin-broadband.co.uk). 40Mbps down, 10Mbps up (could have more!). Bye-bye to “slow” old 2Mbps [ADSL 2+](en.wikipedia.org/wiki/G.992.5), hello to downloading films in 5 minutes!

events.event: Moved off FTTC to a full FTTP connection. 150Mbps down, 30Mbps up. Bye-bye to “slow” old 40Mbps FTTC, hello to downloading films in 1 minute!
events.markdown: Moved off FTTC to a full [FTTP](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fiber_to_the_x) connection. 150Mbps down, 30Mbps up. Bye-bye to “slow” old 40Mbps FTTC, hello to downloading films in 1 minute!
